description:
#################
# help menu
#################
[root@cnode35-m ~(keystone_admin)]# nova help floating-ip-create
usage: nova floating-ip-create [<floating-ip-pool>]

Allocate a floating IP for the current tenant.

Positional arguments:
  <floating-ip-pool> Name of Floating IP Pool. (Optional)

#################
# error log
#################
[root@cnode35-m ~(keystone_admin)]# nova floating-ip-create
ERROR: FloatingIpPoolNotFound: Floating ip pool not found. (HTTP 404) (Request-ID: req-224995d7-b1bf-4b82-83f6-d9259c1ca265)
title: nova floating-ip-create need pool name

comments.content:
My openstack is RedHat OpenStack.

[root@cnode36-m dev(keystone_admin)]# rpm -qa |grep nova
openstack-nova-novncproxy-2014.1.1-3.el6.noarch
openstack-nova-console-2014.1.1-3.el6.noarch
python-nova-2014.1.1-3.el6.noarch
openstack-nova-cert-2014.1.1-3.el6.noarch
openstack-nova-common-2014.1.1-3.el6.noarch
python-novaclient-2.17.0-2.el6.noarch

openstack-nova-api-2014.1.1-3.el6.noarch

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~choonho-son

comments.content:
After setting default_floating_pool to "public", it works well.
Since my pool name was "public" instead of nova.

I installed RedHat OpenStack with packstack. I think openstack-puppet needs to update nova.conf


See https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1355621
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~choonho-son

comments.content:
The code expects a pool to be given or the default_floating_pool to be set in nova.conf.  See https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/network/floating_ips.py#L210:
    pool = pool or CONF.default_floating_pool
Since you specified neither of those, the exception you saw is legit.

I actually tried this on the latest code (on the nova master branch).  If I specify no pool and disable the default_floating_pool in nova.conf, I would see the following error:
    $ nova floating-ip-create
    ERROR (NotFound): No more floating ips available. (HTTP 404) (Request-ID: req-8f19946f-0614-4496-bf03-d8e1aa099fe4)

Looks like we need the proper exception needs to be thrown.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~thang-pham

comments.content: I am also using nova-network.  The proper exception is thrown if you are using neutron.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~thang-pham

comments.content:
Related fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/120587
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/120587
Committed: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/commit/?id=b13be2cd56a22cf3b66f4b19c3f07b25652670b2
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit b13be2cd56a22cf3b66f4b19c3f07b25652670b2
Author: Thang Pham <email address hidden>
Date:   Wed Sep 10 17:15:40 2014 -0400

    Check for floating IP pool in nova-network
    
    There are no checks in nova-network to see if a specified
    floating IP pool exists or not before attempting to allocate
    an IP address. If a pool does not exist, nova throws an
    unrelated error - 'No more floating ips available'. The
    following patch adds a check for the existence of the IP pool
    and throws a FloatingIpPoolNotFound if it is not found.
    
    Change-Id: I72cb8dd044f7ac094287bad7df9167b8e77a4b5b
    Related-Bug: #1355623
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
This is an automated cleanup. This bug report has been closed because it
is older than 18 months and there is no open code change to fix this.
After this time it is unlikely that the circumstances which lead to
the observed issue can be reproduced.

If you can reproduce the bug, please:
* reopen the bug report (set to status "New")
* AND add the detailed steps to reproduce the issue (if applicable)
* AND leave a comment "CONFIRMED FOR: <RELEASE_NAME>"
  Only still supported release names are valid (LIBERTY, MITAKA, OCATA, NEWTON).
  Valid example: CONFIRMED FOR: LIBERTY
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mzoeller
